image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Police will allege Samantha Murphy was murdered on the day she vanished after leaving her Ballarat East home for a morning run more than a month ago.

title.children: Missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy died in 'deliberate attack', police allege

image.altText: A script counter at a pharmacy, with an unidentifiable man waiting in line.

props.synopsis: A trial allowing some ACT pharmacies to supply eligible people with the contraceptive pill and medication for urinary tract infections is expanded to include minor skin condition treatments.

title.children: Canberra pharmacies to prescribe medications for minor skin conditions, but GPs remain concerned

image.altText: Former Queensland state cricketer, Ian Harold King, 68.

props.synopsis: Justice Belinda Baker says Ian Harold King's "offending consisted of a grave breach of trust" at a time when he was working as a junior cricket coach in the ACT.

title.children: 'Master manipulator and predator': Paedophile cricket coach jailed for further 23 years

image.altText: Jack Fitzgibbon smiling at camera next to Joel Fitzgibbon

props.synopsis: Lance Corporal Jack Fitzgibbon, the son of former defence minister Joel Fitzgibbon, dies after being injured in a parachuting incident at the Richmond RAAF base last night.

title.children: Son of former defence minister dies after parachute incident at Sydney RAAF base

image.altText: A close shot of Dutton speaking from the Prime Minister's courtyard.

props.synopsis: As the Liberals recover from their loss in the Dunkley by-election with a frontbench reshuffle, the lack of women in their ranks flags problems to come, writes Brett Worthington.

title.children: Everyone gets a prize in Peter Dutton's reshuffle but there's an omission he has no solution for

image.altText: An elderly woman with short, white hair.

props.synopsis: The 95-year-old died in hospital in May 2023 after falling and hitting her head following an alleged incident with a police officer.

title.children: Family of Clare Nowland resolves civil suit against NSW over alleged taser death

image.altText: A shorter Asian man in a suits shakes hands with a smiling Anthony Albanese on a stage

props.synopsis: Today, Vietnam and Australia signed a "comprehensive strategic partnership", officially elevating ties to the highest level adopted by the one-party state, as Canberra follows hot on the heels of both Washington and Beijing. So why has the so-called land of the blue dragon suddenly become so popular?

title.children: Like the popular kid in class, everyone wants Vietnam on their team which is why Australia just inked a new deal

image.altText: Katy Gallagher press club

props.synopsis: The government has announced plans to pay superannuation to those on paid parental leave. Here's how it would work, and how it would affect parents.

title.children: How much could parents benefit from super on parental leave?

image.altText: Tom Starling looks into the camera with bruising to his face and blood.

props.synopsis: A Canberra Raiders NRL star faced seven charges after a night out at on the Central Coast. They were dropped, and now the police who arrested him have pleaded not guilty to assault.

title.children: Two NSW police officers plead not guilty over alleged assault of Raiders star Tom Starling

image.altText: Richard Marles gives evidence at the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide.

props.synopsis: Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles was asked why the government rejected a request for a 12-month extension while giving evidence at the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide today.

title.children: Defence minister says families of veteran suicide will be left 'unheard' as royal commission won't be extended

image.altText: Two children sitting barefoot on a brick driveway

props.synopsis: WA Police has rubbished claims the Broome house where three young children were found cable-tied together has been vandalised.

title.children: Police rubbish claims Broome home where kids were found cable-tied was vandalised

image.altText: Dane Rampe and Max Gawn pose for a photo in front of the Sydney Opera House

props.synopsis: The 2024 AFL season is set to get underway at the SCG, as the Sydney Swans host Melbourne to launch Opening Round. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Sydney hosts AFL season opener as Swans and Demons kick off Opening Round

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ABC Sport is bringing the blogs for the 2024 AFL season

image.altText: A group of Australian athletes stand in Olympic uniforms with Sydney Harbour and the Harbour Bridge behind them.

props.synopsis: Indigenous artwork is taking pride of place on Australia's uniforms for the Olympic Games in Paris starting in late July.

title.children: Indigenous print with a nod to Japan. Australia unveils its Olympic uniforms

image.altText: Spencer Leniu points to the sky during Sydney Rooster-Brisbane Broncos NRL match in Las Vegas.

props.synopsis: Sydney Roosters forward Spencer Leniu is facing a lengthy suspension following his admission he made a racist remark towards Brisbane Broncos five-eighth Ezra Mam during last Sunday's NRL match in Las Vegas.

title.children: Leniu apologises to Mam after admitting to racist slur

image.altText: Sperm injection process

props.synopsis: The law protects in vitro fertilisation providers from potential legal liability raised by a court ruling that equated frozen embryos to children.

title.children: Alabama governor signs bill into law giving IVF clinics legal cover

image.altText: A building site in the forest.

props.synopsis: Indonesia's outgoing president is leaving his utopian vision for a jungle capital to his successors to build. Will they pull the plug?

title.children: The $45 billion headache Indonesia has created deep in the jungles of Borneo

image.altText: A composite of Lawler in a red jacket in Parliament, and Potter in a shirt standing outside

props.synopsis: NT Police Minister Brent Potter is under pressure over now-deleted Facebook posts he shared on his profile, which included homophobic and racial slurs and misogynistic language.

title.children: 'He was an idiot': NT chief minister backs police minister after racist Facebook posts

image.altText: A woman with a large coat on looks on, away from the camera, as snow falls

props.synopsis: These wives and mothers of Russia's mobilised soldiers are risking the ire of Vladimir Putin and the Kremlin with their weekly protests, which come at an awkward time for the president.

title.children: Why wives and mothers could be a big problem for Vladimir Putin

image.altText: Black and white image of a woman wearing a dress in the foreground, old brick buildings and hand written papers in background.

props.synopsis: Until the late 1960s, abortion was illegal in Australia. With limited access to contraception, many women, like my great-grandmother, unlawfully attempted to terminate unwanted pregnancies.

title.children: My great-grandmother was just 36 when she died but before she did she had to hide the cause from police

image.altText: A man with sunglasses propped on his forehead.

props.synopsis: The family of Kamilaroi-Dunghutti man Ricky "Dougie" Hampson Jnr say they want to "save the next life that's in the same situation".

title.children: Mother tells inquest she is 'empty and broken' following the fatal misdiagnosis of her son

image.altText: A collage of images showing abusive teachers who worked in Victorian government schools

props.synopsis: The release of a 466-page report into historical sexual abuse at a Melbourne primary school will take weeks, perhaps months to fully digest. But for now, there is hope that it could kickstart a reckoning that may last for years, writes Russell Jackson.

title.children: A landmark school sex abuse inquiry has made horrific findings and the reckoning from it may last years

image.altText: Rust movie armourer Hannah Gutierrez-Reed.

props.synopsis: A New Mexico jury finds Rust armourer Hannah Gutierrez guilty of involuntary manslaughter, ending a trial over Hollywood's first on-set fatal shooting in nearly 30 years.

title.children: Jury finds armourer guilty of involuntary manslaughter in fatal shooting on set of Alec Baldwin movie Rust

image.altText: The Tesla brand logo.

props.synopsis: Tesla quits the national car lobby, saying it has deceived customers over the government's proposed CO2 scheme for vehicles.

title.children: Tesla quits motoring lobby over claims group deceived customers on CO2 scheme

image.altText: A red panda peeks out of a wicker basket after it was found by Thai customs.

props.synopsis: Thai customs officials arrest six people for attempting to smuggle a red panda and 86 other animals out of the kingdom, including snakes, parrots and monitor lizards, officials say.

title.children: Endangered red panda found stuffed into luggage at Thai airport

image.altText: housing estate shot from a drone

props.synopsis: Lending for home loans has fallen. Meanwhile, the nation's would-be first Islamic bank fails to get a full licence. And the ASX 200 closes higher after stocks in Commonwealth Bank hit a record high.

title.children: As it happened: Home loan lending slumps, nation's first Islamic bank fails to get licence, ASX closes higher

image.altText: Close up of a crocodile's eye

props.synopsis: Wildlife experts explain possible reasons a 3-metre crocodile lurking in a popular creek didn't strike out at a family playing frighteningly close as a search discovers more crocs nearby.

title.children: A family came within metres of a crocodile in a swimming hole. So why didn't it attack?

image.altText: 'No cash no hope' spraypainted in black on a green metal shed next to a highway.

props.synopsis: Bankwest has conceded it did not consult the community about its snap closure of multiple branches across regional Western Australia, but says 15 of these will be taken over by the Commonwealth Bank.

title.children: Bankwest's 'ultimate betrayal' leaves regional communities in the dark over country branch closures

image.altText: A university graduate wearing a gown and cap is seen outside Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: Executive director of The Australia Institute, Richard Dennis, says the government collects more money from HECS than the PRRT. RMIT ABC Fact Check runs the numbers.

title.children: Does the government really collect more money from HECS than it does from the PRRT?

image.altText: Wallabies players look sad

props.synopsis: Rugby Australia chief executive Phil Waugh says the expenses racked up as part of the Wallabies' failed World Cup tilt are "not acceptable".

title.children: Rugby Australia reveals $2.6m unapproved 'over-investment' for Wallabies' disastrous World Cup campaign

image.altText: A still from a AFLNT match which shows multiple players standing around, one players arm is holding the shirt of an umpire.

props.synopsis: The PINT Football Club player has been suspended for more than a season and deregistered over the altercation, and could be banned from playing for life.

title.children: NTFL player banned for 20 games after hurling young umpire to the ground

image.altText: A smiling man wearing black glasses crouches in front of a small black dog while a young girl looks on beside him.

props.synopsis: With dog ownership increasing during the pandemic, and the pets being welcomed into more public spaces like cafes, experts say families with a child who experiences cynophobia can find day-to-day activities stressful.

title.children: Why some children fear dogs and how to help them overcome it

image.altText: A woman looks on with her hands behind her head.

props.synopsis: The manager of Sam Kerr's Women's Super League club says the Matildas star has its "full support", after she was charged with the racially aggravated harassment of a police officer in London.

title.children: Sam Kerr has English club's 'full support' as criminal charge looms over star

image.altText: an anonymous photo of a woman turned away from the camera in a children's playground

props.synopsis: Early in her marriage, Sophia went to the police after being controlled by her husband, but they didn't even interview her. It was years before she finally left him.

title.children: Sophia was a victim of coercive control for more than 17 years. Her teenage daughter ended the abuse

image.altText: A man from an Air Force search team in a headset looks out a plane window looking at the ocean.

props.synopsis: Searches costing $200 million were unable to locate flight MH370, but investigators are hopeful new technology and techniques will lead to the missing plane and solve the 10-year-old aviation mystery.

title.children: How do you search for a missing plane? Investigators hopeful new hunt will solve MH370 mystery

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents
